intro: Elemifera tecomaca, commonly known as the tecomate or tecomilla, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal.
